I would look at the Ant tasks for running junit tests, "junit" and
"junit-report".  The junit task outputs a great deal of information in
convenient XML format, and junit-report creates cool reports that seem to
have most of the information you're looking for.

If you're using the text runner, it shouldn't be a huge effort to switch it
over to Ant.

Hope this helps...

-----Original Message-----
From: dcarissi [mailto:danc@...] 
Sent: Wednesday, January 14, 2004 4:07 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Can I control JUnit's output??


We run JUnit in batch mode by calling 
  junit.textui.TestRunner()

As the test runs, I get the periods across the screen for each 
testcase that has run.  When it's done, I see the summary of elapsed 
time and number of testcases run along with any error stack traces.  
Is there any way that I can change this output??  For example, it 
would be nice to display the information like the name of the class, 
name of the test method being run, and followed by either a 
successful message or a failure message with the associated stack 
trace.  Is this possible and if so, what's the magic code sequence??? Thanks
in advance for any help!!!!
